comments:
Hi      I am quite new Eclipse / Eclipse WTP framework . I am trying to add Oracle Runtime to Eclipse WTP using plug in and  Extension points . I have go the new plug in registered and when i try to invoke oracle jsr 110 implementation using

 WSDLFactory wsdlFactory = WSDLFactory.newInstance("oracle.webservices.wsdl.WSDLFactoryImpl");

I am getting the below mentioned error .It throw a classnot found error but the issue is Eclipse is trying to load it from Bundle Data for org.wsdl4j 
instead of the plug in bundle , which has oracle jar bundled as dependant jar .


Any help of this front would be of great help.

Thanks
Tithosh

As it stands we don't claim to support any other WSDLFactory other than the reference implementation that ships with the wsdl4j plugin.  Due to the classloading behaviour of eclipse it's often possible to run into problems when using code that passes class names around and expects a different plugin to be able to instantiate a class for the name.  I'm changing the severity from major-->enhancement to reflect this.

BTW... is there some reason why you want to use WSDLFactory.newInstance() instead of simply instantiating your class?
This bug 103504 seems similar. In any case, the org.wsdl4j plug-in is no more as of WTP 2.0. It has moved to Orbit www.eclipse.org/orbit and renamed javax.wsdl.
